definition: Wu Zetian (624-705), Tang empress, reigned 690-705
surname Wu
martial/military
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items
day/sky/heaven

sentences.english: Empress Wu's remarks aroused a high degree of vigilance Di Gong.
sentences.chinese: 武则天的话引起了狄公高度的警惕。

sentences.english: The reason why the Empress Wu did not kill him, because he established the snake spirit organization.
sentences.chinese: 而武则天之所以没杀他，是因为他建立了蛇灵组织。

sentences.english: This change happens when Wu Zetian's power rises to a historical height.
sentences.chinese: 这个变化是在武则天走向权力颠峰的背景下出现的。

sentences.english: Famous poet Li Bai, once regarded her as one of the seven sages in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 著名诗人李白，就把武则天列为唐朝“七圣”之一。

sentences.english: The decrees for pardon that are delivered during Wu Zetian's rule begin to experience great changes.
sentences.chinese: 在武则天时期所颁布的赦文中开始出现了重大的变化。

sentences.english: But for the Empress, and the actress, the imprisonments were only temporary setbacks.
sentences.chinese: 但对于武则天和刘晓庆而言，监禁只是暂时的困难。

sentences.english: Believe that the strength of their own be able to better my Wu.
sentences.chinese: 相信的自己的实力能够把武则天演好。

sentences.english: Empress Wu was also one of the most powerful champions of Buddhism in China.
sentences.chinese: 武则天也是中国历史上最强势的佛教拥护者。

sentences.english: Empress Wu of the Tang dynasty was the only female Emperor of China .
sentences.chinese: 武则天唐代是中国唯一的女皇帝。

sentences.english: Wu came from the land of the special care and favor.
sentences.chinese: 武则天从太平降世就对她倾泻了特别的关心和溺爱。

definition: Emperor Zhongzong of Tang, reign name of fourth Tang emperor Li Zhe 李哲[Li3 Zhe2] (656-710), reigned 705-710

Yang Yuhuan or Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1] (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Emperor Gaozong of Tang, reign name of third Tang emperor Li Zhi 李治[Li3 Zhi4] (628-683), reigned 649-683

Di Renjie (607-700), Tang dynasty politician, prime minister under Wu Zetian, subsequently hero of legends/master sleuth Judge Dee, aka Chinese Sherlock Holmes, in novel Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee 狄公案[Di2 gong1 an4] translated by Dutch sinologist R.H. van Gulik 高羅珮|高罗佩[Gao1 Luo2 pei4]
Tang Emperor Xuanzong (685-762), also known as Emperor Ming of Tang 唐明皇[Tang2 Ming2 huang2], reign name of seventh Tang emperor 李隆基[Li3 Long1 ji1], reigned 712-756
Li Shimin, personal name of second Tang emperor Taizong 唐太宗[Tang2 Tai4 zong1] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Emperor Taizong of Tang, reign name of second Tang emperor Li Shimin 李世民[Li3 Shi4 min2] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Princess Taiping (c. 665-713), Tang Dynasty princess, politically powerful and known for her beauty
Emperor Ruizong of Tang, reign name of sixth Tang emperor Li Dan 李旦[Li3 Dan4] (662-716), reigned 684-690 and 710-712
Liu Chan 劉禪|刘禅 (207-271), son of Liu Bei, reigned as Shu Han emperor 233-263
Li Zhi, personal name of third Tang emperor Gaozong 唐高宗[Tang2 Gao1 zong1], (628-683), reigned 649-683
Gaozong Emperor, Temple name of the tenth Song Emperor Zhao Gou 趙構|赵构[Zhao4 Gou4] (1107-1187 AD), reigned (1127-1162 AD)
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Li Dan, personal name of sixth Tang emperor Ruizong 唐睿宗[Tang2 Rui4 zong1] (662-716), reigned 684-690 and 710-712

Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2] or Yang Guifei (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Wang Zhaojun (52-19 BC), famous beauty at the court of Han emperor Yuan 漢元帝|汉元帝[Han4 Yuan2 di4], one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3]
